articles.title: Global stock market rout gathers pace as fears of US recession grow
articles.description: US MONEY LIVEBLOG: Follow all the updates as markets tumbles across the world
articles.content:
US stock index futures tumbled on Monday - as fears of the United States tipping into recession following weak data last week rippled through global markets.

The tech-heavy Nasdaq plunged 5 percent i... [619 symbols]
articles.summary: US stock index futures fell as fears of a recession grew, leading to a 5 percent drop in Nasdaq. This comes after Japan experienced its worst sell-off since Black Monday in 1987. JPMorgan, the world's largest bank, now predicts a 50 percent recession and predicts that the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates more quickly and by a larger margin than planned. This will bring down borrowing costs for Americans for credit cards, loans and mortgages.

articles.title: Simone Biles appears to HIT OUT at Olympics crowd after beam error
articles.description: Biles failed to make it onto the podium for the first time at this summer's Games in Paris after a rare error saw her lose her footing and briefly step off the beam.
articles.content:
Simone Biles was left fuming with Olympics fans for 'shushing' in the middle of her balance beam routine on Monday after the USA gymnastics legend missed out on a medal.

Biles failed to make it onto ... [818 symbols]
articles.summary: US gymnastics star Simone Biles was reportedly angry with Olympics fans for'shushing' during her balance beam routine after she fell off the beam during her routine due to a rare error that caused her to lose her footing and briefly step off the balance beam. Biles and her teammate Suni Lee were confused by the crowd's behavior, claiming they were'shushed' for cheering each other on the floor. Bile had missed out on a medal and was upset that the crowd was'showing' her during her performance.

articles.title: Mother speaks out after daughter's allergy death at Morocco restaurant
articles.description: Lily King, 18, went on a week-long holiday to Rabat with mum Aicha, 56, in June to visit family and celebrate getting top marks in the first year of her economics degree at the University of Exeter.
articles.content:
This is first picture of a promising university student who suffered a string of allergies and died after eating a simple 'chicken and chips' meal on a family holiday in Morocco.

Lily King, 18, went ... [8318 symbols]
articles.summary: Lily King, a promising university student, died after eating a simple 'chicken and chips' meal at Maya restaurant and Lounge in Rabat, Morocco during a family holiday in June. Her mother, Aicha King, spoke to the restaurant about her daughter's allergies, which included dairy, fish, shellfish, sesame, and nuts. Within minutes, Lily developed a severe reaction to the food, leading to vomiting, stomach cramps, and breathing problems. Despite using her Epi-pen, Mrs King was unable to leave the restaurant without paying the bill and was forced to take Lily to hospital. After a heart attack, Lily had a catonic fit and was diagnosed as being brain dead at the hospital. The restaurant, which also doubles as a bar-cum-nightclub, claims to offer 'an exclusive yet impeccable culinary journey' and boasts a 'long history of luxury hospitality'.

articles.title: Hurricane Debby Disrupts Thousands Of Flights
articles.description: Debby made landfall in Florida on Monday morning as a category 1 hurricane, bringing flight delays and cancellations along the eastern seaboard.
articles.content:
ebby made landfall near Steinhatchee on Florida’s northeastern coast on Monday morning as a category 1 hurricane with winds of 80 m.p.h. and heavy downpours.

The U.S. air travel system is preparing f... [2435 symbols]
articles.summary: Hurricane Debby, a category 1 hurricane, made landfall near Steinhatchee on Florida's northeastern coast on Monday morning causing over 1,200 flight cancellations and delays in and out of U.S. airports. Three of the "Big Four" airlines, American, Southwest, and Delta, were responsible for over 660 flight cancellation and 680 delays. The Department of Transportation requires customers to offer a refund if their flights are canceled or significantly delayed due to reasons within the airline's control, but this rule does not apply to weather-related delays and cancellations. Major US. airlines have issued travel waivers allowing passengers flying in or out of impacted airports to rebook without paying the fare difference. American Airlines has issued two travel alerts impacting 15 airports in Florida and nine more up and down the east coast, while Delta has issued a travel alert covering seven airports in Georgia and seven in Florida. JetBlue Airways and Spirit Airlines have also issued travel alerts covering seven and four airports. Travelers can rebook their flights at no charge within two weeks.

She stated that they have different backgrounds and interests and that they come to different conclusions all the time. In the interview, she also mentioned that she trusts JD's intention and that he treats her opinions with respect. She also commented on her support for the Trump-Vance ticket, which she felt would do some real good for the country. JD Vance has faced criticism for his past comments about "childless" women and anti-Trump remarks.

articles.title: Graham Thorpe's heartbroken father says his family are 'devastated'

The father of Graham Thorpe said the family were 'devastated' by the death of the cricket legend at the age of just 55.

The England great has passed away two years after falling ill with a mystery il... [12405 symbols]
articles.summary: Cricketer legend Graham Thorpe has passed away at the age of 55, two years after falling ill with a mystery illness. His father, Geoff, stated that his family are 'devastated' by the news. Thorpe made his international debut in 1993 and went on to play 100 Tests, scoring 16 centuries and playing 82 times for the ODI side. He also had a 17-year career with Surrey. Michael Vaughan and Ben Stokes led tributes to the batting legend. Thorp is survived by his second wife Amanda and four children.

A thug who burgled a library during violent unrest in Liverpool said 'nice one lad' as he was led to the cells today, as a string of suspected rioters were hauled before the courts.

entities.data: Department for Science, Innovation and Technology

articles.summary: Adam Wharton, a 28-year-old career criminal from Walton, pleaded guilty to burglary in relation to serious disorder at the Spellow Library and community hub in Liverpool during violent unrest. He is one of at least 18 defendants, nine adults and a teenager, charged with crimes connected to the riots. The police are battling to regain control of Britain's streets amid fears of further unrest, with far-right organisers on social media listing dozens of immigration centres as targets for attack. A Telegram channel called Southport Wake Up urged its members to attack them at 8pm on Wednesday. Meanwhile, four asylum seekers were found sleeping overnight in woods to escape a mob who torched their hotel in Rotherham. Over 400 people have been arrested following six days of unrest.

Hicks was airlifted to Children’s Hospital, where he died. A fundraiser set up by someone connected to Hicks' preschool has raised over $13,500 so far. The incident occurred at the Southern Maryland Blue Crabs game on Friday night. A second child sustained non-life-threatening injuries. The boy's flag football team has dedicated its upcoming season to him.

articles.title: ‘Republicans for Harris’ launch features key names, impressive numbers
articles.description: Given the state of the GOP, it’s not easy for any Democratic candidate to pick up cross-party backing, but Kamala Harris is now backed by many Republicans.
articles.content: Nine days into her 2024 candidacy, Vice President Kamala Harris picked a couple of notable Republican endorsements: Former Georgia Lt. Gov. Geoff Duncan threw his support behind the Democrat fairly qu... [3367 symbols]
articles.summary: Vice President Kamala Harris has received significant Republican endorsements nine days into her 2024 candidacy, with former Georgia Lt. Gov. Geoff Duncan and Mayor John Giles of Mesa, Arizona’s third-largest city endorsing her. The endorsements come from former Trump White House officials Stephanie Grisham and Olivia Troye, former Secretaries Chuck Hagel and Ray LaHood, former Governors Jim Edgar, Bill Weld, and Christine Todd Whitman, former U.S. House members Rod Chandler, Tom Coleman, Dave Emery, Wayne Gilchrest, Jim Greenwood, Adam Kinzinger, John LeBoutillier, Susan Molinari, Jack Quinn, and Denver Riggleman, Claudine Schneider, Christopher Shays, Peter Smith, Alan Steelman, David Trott, and Joe Walsh. The “Republicans for Harris” rollout is more than simply including names on a list, but also a “campaign within a campaign” using well-known Republicans to activate their networks. The program will begin with events in Arizona, North Carolina and Pennsylvania.

articles.title: It was unusually quiet at the Olympics balance beam final, and Sunisa Lee says the gymnasts noticed
articles.description: An unusually quiet arena may have played a factor in a shaky balance beam final for Simone Biles, Sunisa Lee and a handful of other event finalists Monday. Biles, Lee, Brazil's Julia Soares and Romania's Sabrina Maneca-Voinea all fell during their routines inside Bercy Arena, where no music was played and some fans hushed others for making noise while the athletes were up. Italy's Alice D'Amato barely wobbled, by comparison, on her way to gold.
articles.content: PARIS — An unusually quiet arena may have played a factor in a shaky balance beam final for Simone Biles, Sunisa Lee and a handful of other event finalists Monday. Biles, Lee, Brazil's Julia Soares an... [456 symbols]
articles.summary: An unusually quiet environment at the Olympics' balance beam final may have contributed to a shaky performance for Simone Biles, Sunisa Lee, Julia Soares, and Romania's Sabrina Maneca-Voinea who all fell during their routines. The Bercy Arena was unusually quiet, with no music being played and some fans hushed others for making noise during the athletes' performance. Italy's Alice D'Amato won gold, with Biles falling behind Italy's Julia Soare and Romania.

articles.summary: The 49ers have found a plan for their defense without Dre Greenlaw, who is expected to be sidelined for a minimum of four weeks due to a torn Achilles. Greenlaw has been the team's primary defensive player since 2020. The 49ers' plan involves using second-year linebacker Dee Winters and veteran De'Vondre Campbell in place of Greenlaw. Winters, along with Jalen Graham and veteran Demetrius Flannigan-Fowles, could potentially replace Greenlaw when the 49ers use three linebackers. Coach Kyle Shanahan is hopeful that these players will progress significantly in terms of performance.

articles.summary: Dolce & Gabbana has launched a new perfume, Fefé, named after the dog of the brand's co-founder Domenico Dolce. The Italian luxury fashion house's latest campaign includes a video of a dog wearing an exclusive dog collar. For €99 (£84), owners can have their pets smelling of the warm notes of ylang ylang, musk and sandalwood. The new dog mist has a 24-carat gold-plated paw on the glass bottle and is available online. However, it remains uncertain whether there will be a market for this perfume. By 2030, the global pet industry is expected to grow to $500bn from an annual $320bn.

articles.title: North Korea Accuses NATO of Inciting 'New Cold War'

A stat... [3115 symbols]

entities.data: the North Korean Ministry of Foreign Affairs

articles.summary: North Korea has accused the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) of creating a "new Cold War". The North Korean Ministry of Foreign Affairs accused the organization of undermining global stability with its policy of expansion and European armament. The ministry also accused NATO of inciting the Russian invasion of Ukraine with its expansion. This comes amid heightened concern about North Korea's aggressive posturing and threats of nuclear escalation. The comments come amid heightened tensions between North Korea and the West, with missile tests and potential nuclear escalation reported.

Renowned as the creator of the Certified Ethical Hacker credential, EC-Council announced a $15 million pledge to reach over 50,000 students and advance academic institutions with 8 turnkey, hands-on programs to build critical cybersecurity skills across the Ethical Hacking, Network Defense, Digital Fore
articles.content:
Scholarships to reach over 50,000 students and advance academic institutions with 8 turnkey, hands-on programs to build critical cybersecurity skills across the nation.

WASHINGTON, D.C., Aug. 5, 2024... [4603 symbols]

entities.data: Office of the National Cyber Director
the Executive Office of the President

articles.summary: The White House has announced a $15 million pledge from EC-Council, a cybersecurity certification, education, training, and services organization, to accelerate skill development in the nation's cyber workforce. The pledge aims to reach over 50,000 students and advance academic institutions with 8 turnkey, hands-on programs to build critical cybersecurity skills across the nation. The initiative will provide scholarships offering access to an extensive cybersecurity curriculum and instructional videos to academic institutions in the United States, including universities, National Security Agency's (NSA) Centers of Academic Excellence (CAEs), community colleges, career schools, and non-profit organizations. This pledge comes at a time when the need to close the cyber skills gap has become more critical, with estimates predicting a shortfall of 3.5 million cybersecurity professionals by 2025. EC-CEC supports over 800 Institutions of Higher Education in North America alone with turnkey cyber programs.

articles.summary: JP Morgan Chase CEO, Jamie Dimon, has advised the next US president to bring together the nation and restore faith in America. He suggested that the next president should bring in political opponents and figures from the private sector to his administration. Dimon also urged the presidential candidates to refrain from attacking those with different political ideologies. The comments were made in an annual shareholder letter from Dimon. He defended the firm's diversity and equality efforts, defending them against accusations of discriminatory and promoting left-wing ideology. He maintained that the U.S. must continue to hold its leadership role in the West or it will eventually cede it to China as an authoritarian superpower.

articles.title: Ukraine's F-16 success relies on key strategy—war analysts

entities.data: the Institute for the Study of War

articles.summary: Ukraine will need to target Russia's key air defense systems behind the front lines to keep its new F-16 fighter jets operational, according to a new analysis by the Institute for the Study of War (ISW), a U.S. think tank. The analysis suggests that Ukraine will continue efforts to target Russian air defense assets within the Russian rear and in occupied Ukraine with Western-provided long-range weapons to enable its use of F.16 jets. Ukraine confirmed its acquisition of its first F-8s after days of speculation and statements from officials outside of the country. The jets will be a significant upgrade to Ukraine's Soviet-era air force, which has been under siege for two and a half years. However, Moscow has reportedly offered rewards for destroying F-6s.

articles.summary: The review praises the performance of Andreas Homoki's time-shifting backstage Carmen at Edinburgh's Festival theatre, which was commissioned and premiered in 1875 at Paris's Opéra Comique. The performance was met with a lack of impact due to the location of the building and memories of Carmens past. Gaëlle Arquez's portrayal of Carmen is particularly engaging, with Saimir Pirgu's Don José and Elbenita Kajtazi's Micaëla both performing well. The Scottish Chamber Orchestra and the Opéa Comique's children's chorus performed well, while the production's stageness was criticised for its stageness and lack of cohesion.

articles.summary: Hurricane Debby rapidly intensified before its landfall in Florida, joining a growing list of recent storms that have done so. Rapid intensification is a process of increasing in strength over a short period of time, but it is considered a rapid intensifier unless its winds increase by 35 mph in 24 hours or less. The storm strengthened from a 45 mph tropical storm to an 80 mph hurricane at 2 a.m. Monday. However, the storm is moving slowly, meaning there is a significant threat from excessive rain. Local concerns include a potential sewage spill in the region due to recent rainfall.

articles.summary: Opponents are planning to fight against the Project 2025 agenda, which could be implemented if Donald Trump wins a second term in the White House. Influential conservative organizations led by the Heritage Foundation are drafting policy papers and hiring potential staffers for the extremist plans. While Trump has publicly disceased himself from the project, opponents are preparing to push back. Liberal advocacy groups and Democratic state officials have been researching case law, allocating resources and identifying potential plaintiffs for lawsuits challenging Project 2025. The ACLU's executive director, Anthony Romero, stated that litigation will be a key tool to preserve the status quo and play for time. The liberal advocacy group Democracy Forward has developed a "threat matrix" to challenge Project 2025 proposals. Washington Attorney General Bob Ferguson said the first Trump administration was sloppy in its rollout of executive orders, including the first Muslim travel ban.

articles.summary: The Wall Street Fear Gauge has hit its highest level since 2020 due to a predicted decline in college enrollment, with all three major indexes including the Nasdaq, and the CBOE Volatility Index. Forbes has released its latest annual College Financial Grades list, which lists around half of the private, nonprofit colleges that earned a C grade or worse. The financial health of a college is critical due to the expected decline in the college-age population expected to decline in two years, meaning colleges will be competing with a shrinking pool of applicants. All 10 of the world's 10 richest people lost at least $1 billion, including Tesla's Elon Musk ($5.2 billion), LVMH CEO Bernard Arnault ($3.1 billion), and Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg ($33.3 billion). Jeff Bezos' net worth fell by nearly $16 billion after Amazon's stock fell by more than 9% following disappointing quarterly earnings. Meanwhile, Intel announced it would cut 15,000 jobs, or 15% of its workforce, and halt dividends. Amish communities in eastern Ohio are increasingly favoring electric bikes and solar panels, as well as solar panels and batteries that keep them powered up.

articles.title: A rebuilt bronze Jackie Robinson statue will be unveiled 6 months after the original was stolen
articles.description: Little League players and former Major League Baseball All-Stars are ready to welcome home a rebuilt bronze statue of Jackie Robinson. The original sculpture of the baseball icon resting a bat on his shoulder was cut off at its ankles by thieves in January, leaving only Robinson's cleats behind at McAdams Park in Wichita, Kansas. The identical statue is returning to the park where about 600 children play in the urban youth baseball league called League 42. It's named after Robinson's uniform number with the Brooklyn Dodgers, with whom he broke the league's racial barrier in 1947. The community will be joined Monday by representatives of Major League Baseball and former major league players.

articles.summary: A rebuilt bronze statue of Jackie Robinson, a baseball icon, will be unveiled at McAdams Park in Wichita, Kansas, six months after the original was destroyed by thieves. The statue was cut off at its ankles, leaving only Robinson's cleats behind. An identical statue will return to the park, where about 600 children play in the urban youth baseball league called League 42. The community was inundated with donations after the news of the theft spread across the country. The replacement statue is identical to the original and will be dedicated in 2021. Ricky Alderete was sentenced to 18 months in prison and ordered to pay $41,500 restitution for stealing the statue.

articles.summary: Kamala Harris has secured enough votes from delegates to become the Democratic National Committee's nominee for president, according to the Democratic Party Chair Jaime Harrison. The announcement was made before the online voting process ends on Monday, marking the end of the campaign's momentum after President Joe Biden ended his reelection bid and endorsed Harris as his successor. Harris, who would be the first woman of color at the top of a major party's ticket, joined a call with supporters to congratulate her and express her pride in her nomination. The Marlborough Democratic City Committee issued a statement supporting Harris' nomination and thanking President Biden for his patriotism. They also rejected claims that Harris' position could hinder Democrats from choosing their nominee.

articles.title: 2020 presidential election conspiracy theories live on in Michigan's GOP primary

articles.summary: The outcome of the Michigan Republican primary could disrupt the retirement of Sheryl Guy, the county's top elections official in Antrim County, who has worked for over four decades. Five candidates are vying to replace Guy, who had been in the position for 12 years. One of these candidates has been vocal and vocal about election conspiracies, and Guy plans to run as a write-in candidate in the general election if he wins. This is part of a larger trend of Republican candidates promoting election conspirations or skepticism of voting and ballot counting, despite no evidence of widespread fraud or problems in the nation's elections. The primary results have been mixed, with some predicting a strong majority of Republican voters still believe Democratic President Joe Biden was not legitimately elected.

articles.summary: Pope Francis has accepted the resignation of Cardinal Sean O’Malley as archbishop of Boston, aged 80, and named Richard Henning, current bishop of Providence, Rhode Island, to replace him. The move comes as part of Pope Francis' main role as head of the Pontifical Commission for the Protection of Minors, suggesting he will remain in that role until a new commission leader is named. St. John Paul II had tapped O'Malley to take over in Boston in 2003 during the height of the clergy sexual abuse scandal. At age 80, O‘Malley is five years beyond the normal retirement age for bishops.

articles.summary: The National Weather Weather Service has warned that severe thunderstorms are expected to hit southeastern Michigan between 2 and 10 p.m. Monday afternoon, when temperatures reach the upper 80s and high humidity levels make it feel at least 10 degrees warmer. The storms can produce heavy downpours, large hail 1 inch or larger, damaging winds reaching up to 60 mph and an isolated tornado. Areas between Michigan 59 and Interstate 94 face a marginal risk of severe thunderstorm, while areas south of Interstate 94 toward the Ohio border face a slight risk (level 2 out of 5) for severe weather. High temperatures will drop into the 60s Tuesday as more comfortable and drier air moves into the region, with high temperatures expected to remain around 80 degrees throughout the week.

articles.title: What Pre-Existing Beliefs About AI At Work Are Hardest To Shift?
articles.description: Employee beliefs can be changed under certain circumstances. Asana hypothesized they could turn skeptics into AI enthusiasts with the right intervention.
articles.content: Given the promised productivity gains of AI, businesses are keen for employees to adopt AI tools. However, the widespread adoption of these tools means overcoming pre-existing beliefs about AI, and so... [4563 symbols]

entities.data: AI mindsets: How to unlock the power of AI

articles.summary: Asana's Work Innovation Lab has identified what pre-existing beliefs about AI at work are most difficult to shift, with 41% of employees showing skepticism about the use of AI in their jobs. The lab found that even the most skeptical employees can be converted into enthusiastic users of AI. The report suggests that focusing on either positive outcomes or addressing concerns directly can be more effective than pushing for a significant mindset shift. Dr. Rebecca Hinds, head of the lab, suggests that employees must accept change and believe that AI will complement their capabilities rather than replace them. Companies must also create a culture of experimentation and make failure okay with AI.

articles.summary: Elon Musk has filed a new lawsuit against OpenAI, alleging that the company breached its founding mission to develop artificial intelligence technology for benefit humanity. The lawsuit, filed in federal court in Northern California, alleges that Sam Altman and Greg Brockman manipulated Musk into co-founding their non-profit venture by promising it would be safer and more transparent than profit-driven alternatives. The new lawsuit argues that OpenAI violated federal racketeering laws in a conspiracy to defraud Musk and that its contract with Microsoft would revoke its rights to OpenAI’s technology once it achieved its AGI.

articles.title: There’s a dark side to the wine industry – and nobody’s talking about it
articles.description: There is a human cost to wine; one that we as consumers should not just be aware of, but actively questioning to ensure change, writes Rosamund Hall. If we don’t, we are all complicit
articles.content: Enjoying a glass of wine is one of life’s simplest and greatest pleasures. It can be a catalyst for sparking emotions and memories of places and times shared with loved ones and friends: songs danced ... [4250 symbols]
articles.summary: The article discusses the dark side of the wine industry, which is being ignored by consumers and the wider agricultural industry. It highlights the issue of labour exploitation and human trafficking within the industry, particularly in France and Italy. Two men, Jilali and Larbi El Guazra, who ran a firm called EG Vitiprest in France for exploiting workers from Morocco, who were coerced into working as grape pickers in Bordeaux. The case highlights the need for consumers to question the companies they buy their wine from. In Italy, several cases are being investigated into “caporalato” or a “gangmaster system”, which involves illicit intermediation of workers. This system has grown steadily since the early 2000s when the Italian government passed laws allowing employment outsourcing. Unsurprisingly, undocumented workers are the most vulnerable to subcontracting practices and lack of accountability and transparency.

articles.summary: Tweetsie Railroad in North Carolina is hosting its annual Railroad Heritage Weekend, which celebrates the golden age of steam with enthusiasts of all ages invited. The weekend, August 24 and 25, features the only time of the year when both of the park's narrow-gauge steam locomotives are running simultaneously. The event is also a unique celebration that highlights the park’s history and a century of narrow-ge locomotive heritage, starting with the East Tennessee and Western North Carolina Railroad (ET&WNC). The event includes train rides, tours of the Locomotive Shop and the Memorabilia Room, and a special "double-header" featuring both locomotive No. 12 and No. 190. Since 1957, Tweetsie Railway has been North Carolina's first theme park for Wild West adventures. Daytime admission is $60 for adults, age 13+ $40 for children, ages 3-12, and $100 for children.

articles.title: Unchanged Wisconsin, Pennsylvania Election Processes Vulnerable to Legal Challenge
articles.description: Pennsylvania and Wisconsin, two states seen as must-wins in the Nov. 5 presidential election, have failed to adopt electoral reforms intended to avoid a repeat of the chaos that followed Republican Donald Trump's attempts to challenge the 2020 election.
articles.content: Pennsylvania and Wisconsin, two states seen as must-wins in the Nov. 5 presidential election, have failed to adopt electoral reforms intended to avoid a repeat of the chaos that followed Republican Do... [7011 symbols]

entities.data: the Electoral Count Reform and Presidential Transition Improvement Act

articles.summary: Pennsylvania and Wisconsin, two states seen as crucial battleground states in the upcoming presidential election, have failed to adopt electoral reforms designed to prevent a repeat of the chaos that followed Republican Donald Trump's attempts to challenge the 2020 election. These reforms include a mandatory Dec. 11 deadline for states to submit certified slates of presidential electors to the Archivist of the United States, expedited court access to resolve challenges, and increased the threshold for objecting to election results in Congress. However, Pennsylvania and Wisconsin have not made any changes, leaving their electoral systems vulnerable to partisan lawsuits and political pressures. Critics fear that a missed certification deadline could hinder presidential electors' votes by the Dec. 17 federal deadline, adding to political claims of a faulty election system and potentially reject state's election results. The Electoral Count Reform and Presidential Transition Improvement Act was passed by Congress in response to these concerns.

The attack targeted four launchers belonging to Russia's advanced S-400 air-defense system. Ukraine has been using long-range Western missiles and naval drones to force the Black Sea Fleet from its Crimea base to its Novorossiysk base. Since the start of the war in February 2022, Ukraine has seriously damaged or sunk at least 15 warships, including the fleet's flagship, Moskva. The British Defense Ministry reported in July that at least 26 Russian vessels had been damaged or destroyed. However, Yörük Işık, a geopolitical analyst from the Bosphorus Observer maritime consultancy based in Istanbul, noted that Moscow is also looking to establish another base in the breakaway Georgian region of Abkhazia.

articles.summary: A rebuilt bronze statue of Jackie Robinson, which was stolen six months ago, will be unveiled alongside representatives from Major League Baseball and former players, including All-Stars CC Sabathia and Dellin Betances. The stolen statue was donated hundreds of thousands of dollars to League 42, which raised funds for the replacement statue and improvements to the plaza where it stands. The new statue was created by artist John Parsons before Lutz died in 2022. One man, Ricky Alderete, was sentenced to 18 months in prison and ordered to pay $41,500 restitution for stealing the statue. The original statue was found at the Negro Leagues Baseball Museum in Kansas City, Missouri.

articles.summary: The use of GenAI to enhance process discovery and optimization is changing the way companies understand and improve their business processes. The combination of process mining and GenAI is helping companies identify common pain points, repetitive manual tasks, or process deviations. This approach combines the precision of machine learning with the human experience of human experience. Companies using this holistic approach can replace manual process models with easier GenAI interfaces and gain better visibility into processes by combining a systems view with a human view. GenAI can also help identify common issues such as repetitive manual task or process deviation. The most transformative part of integrating GenAI into process discovery is its ability to democratize process knowledge across an entire organization.

articles.title: Hawaii Wants to Expand Career-Based Learning but It Needs More Teachers
articles.description: About 500 educators will be receiving up to $8,000 in bonuses this month, but some school leaders aren’t convinced it will be enough to solve Hawaii’s shortage of career technical education teachers. CTE teachers lead courses ranging from broadcast media to engineering in middle and high schools across the state. The classes, which emphasize hands-on […]
articles.content:
Hawaii Wants to Expand Career-Based Learning but It Needs More Teachers

This article was originally published in Honolulu Civil Beat.

About 500 educators will be receiving up to $8,000 in bonuses th... [7974 symbols]
articles.summary: Hawaii is planning to expand Career-Based Learning (CTE) into classrooms across the state, but it is facing a shortage of teachers due to low pay and barriers to licensing. Approximately 25 positions remain unfilled for the 2024-25 school year. The Department of Education (DOE) is providing one-time bonuses to CTE teachers that range from $2,500 to $8,000 based on individual qualifications. The Hawaii State Teachers Association estimates that half of CTE classes in Hawaii schools are taught by teachers who do not have a corresponding license in the subject area. The DOE is also providing a bill this year to ease teacher licensing requirements and allow those with a high school diploma and relevant work and education experience to qualify for a CTE teacher license. However, some school leaders believe these efforts will not be enough to solve the shortage.

articles.summary: Elvis Presley's longest-charting album, Elv1s: 30 Number 1 Hits, has returned to the Billboard 200, where it has spent 204 weeks on the ranking. The album, which was released posthumously, moved just under 8,100 equivalent units in the U.S. during its past tracking frame. The success of the album is largely attributed to millions of American music streaming. Presley is expected to become the first to reach four full years on the chart. This is not the first project to manage at least 200 frames on the list.

articles.title: The Awful Truth About Layoffs: It’s Not Just Numbers
articles.description: A recent survey by Resumebuilder found that half of companies admit that 75% or more of the layoffs they made in the past year weren't necessary to cut costs.
articles.content:
A recent survey by Resumebuilder.com found that half of companies admit that 75% or more of the layoffs they made in the past year weren't necessary to cut costs.
• 80% of respondents said their compa... [3760 symbols]
articles.summary: A survey by Resumebuilder revealed that a survey found that half of companies admitted that 75% or more of their layoffs in the past year were not necessary to cut costs. 80% of respondents said their company chose to lay off an employee instead of firing them, and 31% said that performance is always a factor in layoff decisions. The top reason for hiding termination decisions behind layoffs is to maintain company morale. However, this strategy can cause more harm than good as employees know they're being lied to when told the cuts are due to cost-cutting. The study also revealed that the main reasons for hiding terminations as layoffs included maintaining company morale (62%), avoiding wrongful termination claims (59%), and providing severance (54%). Additionally, 38% cited the desire to avoid hurting employees' feelings.
